text.p: Seamico Securities Plc on Wednesday rated Phatra Thanakit Plc a "sell" at 88 baht, saying the finance and brokerage firm's aggressive lending growth this year raised questions about the quality of its loan portfolio.
Phatra Thanakit shares closed two baht lower at 86 baht on the Thai stock exchange on Wednesday.
Seamico said Phatra Thanakit's outstanding lending grew 19 percent during the first nine months of 1996 against its whole year growth target of 20 percent.

"This aggressive growth is contrary to the industry trend, particularly for a large finance company," it said, adding that lending by large Thai finance firms posted either negligible growth or slight declines this year.
It said Phatra Thanakit's provisions for doubtful loans were less conservative than its peers.

"Despite a deteriorating income quality and falling investment banking revenues, Phatra continues to trade at an unjustifiable premium to the rest of the sector. If one is searching for a finance and securities company stock to ride an eventual market turnaround, there are better choices that will provide better returns," Seamico said.
